# Change: 'dropTable'

Drops an existing table

## Available Attributes ##

<table>
<tr><th>Name</th><th>Description</th><th>Required&nbsp;For</th><th>Supports</th><th>Since</th></tr>
<tr><td style='vertical-align: top'>cascadeConstraints</td><td style='vertical-align: top'>Add the `CASCADE CONSTRAINTS` to the statement</td><td style='vertical-align: top'></td><td style='vertical-align:top'>all</td><td style='vertical-align: top'></td></tr>
<tr><td style='vertical-align: top'>catalogName</td><td style='vertical-align: top'>Name of the catalog</td><td style='vertical-align: top'></td><td style='vertical-align:top'>all</td><td style='vertical-align: top'>3.0</td></tr>
<tr><td style='vertical-align: top'>schemaName</td><td style='vertical-align: top'>Name of the schema</td><td style='vertical-align: top'></td><td style='vertical-align:top'>all</td><td style='vertical-align: top'></td></tr>
<tr><td style='vertical-align: top'>tableName</td><td style='vertical-align: top'>Name of the table to drop</td><td style='vertical-align: top'>all</td><td style='vertical-align:top'>all</td><td style='vertical-align: top'></td></tr>
</table>

            catalogName="cat"

## SQL Generated From Above Sample (MySQL)

{% highlight sql %}
DROP TABLE cat.person;


{% endhighlight %}
